Train model named %txt %n times unless no progress for %n cycles %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: If you want to train (or retrain) a model use a block like this.

custom-block.s: Make results ready for CSV export %l
custom-block.comment: Copy search history to 'results' in a form suitable for exporting to CSV. To do so check the box next to 'results' in the Variables area and right click the value displayed on the Stage.

custom-block.s: Test with validation and test questions
custom-block.comment: Use this to run tests with data that wasn't used in training.
Click this to see details of the model and the search. Also to save your newly trained model.

block.comment: Click these after the search for a good model to see the history of the search.

custom-block.s: Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: Searches for good model size and training options.

custom-block.s: Create training and validation data from %l %br split %l %br And then do %cmdRing

Create a neural net model %txt (expert version) %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with activation function %txt %br with dropout rate %n %br with input size %s %br then %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.comment: Sets up the datasets for training and creates a new deep learning model.

scripts.comment: If you want to train a model to answer questions run the following blocks.

custom-block.s: Open this in a new tab

block-definition.s: Categorical prediction sorted with confidence percentages %'prediction'

block-definition.comment: Reports the input data split into random parts whose sizes are determined by the 'fractions'.

block.comment: Delete items from this copy - not the original data.

block-definition.comment: Reports 'n' lists each 1/nth of the elements of the input list.

custom-block.l: number of elements in each part

block.var: number of elements in each part
number of elements in each part

block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [...] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

This block carries out the given script for each item of the given list, like the primitive FOR EACH. What's different is that it provides the # variable, which will contain the item number in the list of each item in turn, 1 while processing item 1, and so on.

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' $nl perform %'number of experiments' experiments $nl where at first run %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error' $nl Varying these parameters: $nl optimization method %'optimization method' $nl loss function %'loss function' $nl activation function %'activation function' $nl shuffle data %'shuffle data' $nl number of training iterations %'number of training iterations' $nl validation split %'validation split' $nl dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl number of layers %'number of layers' $nl loss weight %'loss weight' $nl accuracy weight %'accuracy weight' $nl duration weight %'duration weight' $nl size weight %'size weight'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment and after 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available. It scores each experiment by adding the weighted values of the loss, accuracy, time to train, and number of parameters.

block-definition.s: Create training and validation data from %'data' $nl split %'split' $nl And then do %'do when ready'
block-definition.comment: Given a list of lists of questions and answer keys randomly breaks it up into training, validation, and testing datasets whose sizes are given by the 'split' list. When finished runs 'do when ready'.

custom-block.comment: Creates the empty datasets that the following adds to.

custom-block.s: Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs
Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

custom-block.comment: Sets up the training and validataion data for subsquent training.

block-definition.s: Search and replace %'number of replacements' times $nl with number of experiments %'number of experiments' $nl with %'number of training cycles' initial number of training cylces $nl do after each experiment finishes %'when an experiment finishes' $nl do after each replacement %'do with parameters' $nl then finally do %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt %br perform %n experiments %br where at first run %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing %br Varying these parameters: %br optimization method %b %br loss function %b %br activation function %b %br shuffle data %b %br number of training iterations %b %br validation split %b %br dropout rate %b %br number of layers %b %br loss weight %n %br accuracy weight %n %br duration weight %n %br size weight %n

Repeatedly waits for questions and answers them using a deep learning model.

block-definition.s: Check if %'model name' is ready for prediction $nl then do %'process answer'
Replace model named %'model name' with the best model found $nl and when finished %'run after replacement' $nl but if there is an error %'run if there is an error'
block-definition.comment: This will replace the model named by the best model found by the 'Search for good neural net model ..." command.

block.var: run if there is an error

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Load neural net from URL %'URL' $nl then when loaded %'do when loaded' $nl unless there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads a model previously saved using the interface on the 'tensorflow.js' page which can be opened using the 'Open support panel ...' block.

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.
Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' (expert version) $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with activation function %'activation function' $nl with dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural network with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. The 'activation function' is applied after the weighted inputs are summed. 'dropout rate' adds some noise to training that helps prevent overfitting to the training data. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Difference Log Loss Mean Squared Error
reluelu hardSigmoid linear relu relu6 selu sigmoid softmax softplus softsign tanh

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times unless no progress for %'stop after' cycles $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. If three is no progress for 'stop after' cycles it will stop early. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Get prediction from model %'name' with input %'input' $nl then %'process prediction' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to predict what the output should be for the 'input'. There is also a block for computing many predictions all at once.
Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

block-definition.s: map %'reporter' on each element of %'list 1' and %'list 2'
block-definition.comment: Reports a list created by applying reporter to corresponding elements of the lists.

custom-block.s: map %repRing on each element of %l and %l

block-definition.s: get features of sentences %'sentences' $nl then do with result %'process result'
block-definition.comment: Passes a list of lists of 512 features of input 'sentences' to 'process result'.
Reports 512 features for the sentence using Google's Universal Sentence Encoder.

custom-block.s: get features of sentences %l %br then do with result %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of 512 features for each sentence.

custom-block.s: get features of sentences %l %br then do with result %cmdRing

variable.list: What is available for turning speech into text?,I want to know more about the speech recognition blocks.,What can I do with the speech recognition blocks?,Are there text-to-speech blocks?,How do I get my program to speak?,How do I add voices to my programs?,I would like to know more about these blocks.,What kinds of AI programming can I do with these blocks?,What are these Snap blocks?

variable.list: Speech recognition,Speech recognition,Speech recognition,Speech synthesis,Speech synthesis,Speech synthesis,AI library,AI library,AI library

item.list: AI library,"This is a library of Snap! blocks that can be used for speaking, listening, and seeing. And there are blocks for doing natural language processing, transfer learning, and creating deep learning neural nets.",/ai/index.html

Speech synthesis,"There is a block named ""speak"" that just says what you type as its input. And there a version that lets you choose the language, voice, volume, pitch, and speed of speaking.Different browsers and operating systems support different languages and voices.",/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-1.html

Speech recognition,There is a simple reporter called 'the next thing spoken' that listens for speech and reports the next things spoken. THere are also full-featured blocks for doing more advanced things. Works best in Chrome where there is support for over 100 languages.,/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-2.html
